creator: prasad.subramanian@sun.com
text:
If a url pattern in jsp property group is specified as /jsp/* , then a HTTP404 
is thrown for any resource(jsp) in that url pattern i.e. under the /jsp/ path.

Test case:
jsp20-tests/jsp2/jspconfneg/include/WC.jsp

creator: kin-man.chung@sun.com
text:
This appears to be a Catalina problem.  By the time
org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service is invoked,
request.getServletPath() returns "/jsp2/jspconfneg/include" instead of
"/jsp2/jspconfneg/include/WC.jsp".  Thus the 404.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
This was filed some time ago. Does that still not work ? If it does not, please
attach a test case.

creator: remm@apache.org
text: I think this mapping scenario works now.
